message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.DM, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of finding a sparse directed k-spanner of a graph, which is a fundamental problem in graph theory and has applications in various fields such as network design and routing. The problem involves both combinatorial and numerical optimization, and the paper presents a polynomial-time approximation algorithm with a performance guarantee that depends on the size of the graph. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), which deals with the design and analysis of efficient algorithms for solving fundamental problems in computer science, including graph algorithms. 

The paper also involves geometric arguments and techniques, as well as numerical analysis, which suggests that cs.CG (Computational Geometry) and cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) are also likely sub-categories. 

Moreover, the paper presents a theoretical result with a performance guarantee, which is related to cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), as these sub-categories deal with the study of discrete structures and networks, respectively.
